citations.narrative:
The individual recently conducted Animal Welfare Act regulated activity without a USDA license. According to an invoice
obtained from a newly licensed facility, the facility purchased 6 red kangaroos (3 females, 1 intact male, and 2 neutered
males) on 3/8/2025 from the individual. The individual does not currently hold an active license and did not at the time of
sale. As part of a search inspection, the site of the individual’s business was visited. During conversation with the
individual, they confirmed the animals were sold to the facility on 3/8/2025. They stated they wanted a USDA license but
were not currently licensed.
No person shall operate as a dealer or exhibitor without a valid license. Failure to obtain the required license with USDA
prevents the Secretary from determining compliance with the Animal Welfare Act to ensure humane treatment of covered
animals. The individual must obtain a license from the USDA to continue conducting regulated activity under the Animal
Welfare Act.
No regulated activities may be conducted until a USDA license is obtained.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.1(a)(1) 
   
Requirements and application. 
The individual recently conducted Animal Welfare Act regulated activity without a USDA license. According to an invoice 
obtained from a newly licensed facility, the facility purchased 6 red kangaroos (3 females, 1 intact male, and 2 neutered 
males) on 3/8/2025 from the individual. The individual does not currently hold an active license and did not at the time of 
sale. As part of a search inspection, the site of the individual’s business was visited. During conversation with the 
individual, they confirmed the animals were sold to the facility on 3/8/2025. They stated they wanted a USDA license but 
were not currently licensed.  
No person shall operate as a dealer or exhibitor without a valid license. Failure to obtain the required license with USDA 
prevents the Secretary from determining compliance with the Animal Welfare Act to ensure humane treatment of covered 
animals. The individual must obtain a license from the USDA to continue conducting regulated activity under the Animal 
Welfare Act. 
 
No regulated activities may be conducted until a USDA license is obtained. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
